THE RUHR.The attached plan for the occupation of tho Ruhr, emanating apparently from the Military Committee of Versaillesr was communicated this morning by M, Loucheor.(Sgd.) M.P.A. HAHK3Y.8, Whitehall Sardens, S.W. 27th April, 1921.Secretary to the Cabinet, SECRET,Translation.Military Coralttoe ofVersailles.NOTE.X9 Territories to be occupiedWill be bounded:To the North by the LIPP& To the East by KAMEN, U1IKA, SCIIWERTE, HA GEN (these localitiesinclusive) in order to join on the East of REKSGHEIDwith the bridgehead of COLOGNE.II. Forces required for the occupation.These foroes will be of sufficient strength at the outsotto take possession of the basin in such a way as to guard against any re-action, They could later be reduced for the occupation. In order to take possession it is estimated that from sixto seven Infantry Divisions and two Cavalry Divisions willbe necessary.III. The parrying out of tho operation.The different columns will debouch simultaneously from the bridgeheads of COLOGNE, DUSSIsLDORP. DUISBOURG and WESSEL, the cavalry passing by the south will afroid important localities so as to surround the district to be occupied from the first day.In principle, the role reserved for the British detachment In this operation will be in the vicinity of the COLOGNE bridgehead,The role reserved for the Belgian forces debouching from WESEL will bo the occupation of the northern portion of the basin.These questions will be arranged amongst the staffs concerned,IV, Time allotted.It Is considered that the operation could be carried out twelve days after the decision of tho Governments,V, Estimate of the cost of occupation and how it ^ is, to be joaloVA rough estimate is 100 million francs approximately, thecost of the operation for the first mbntu.
